title: Schools closed in some Tamil Nadu districts due to heavy rainfall; check list here
text:
Schools closed in some Tamil Nadu districts due to heavy rainfall; check list here Schools closed: Following the cloudburst, districts like Chennai, Ramanathapuram, Dindigul, Pudukottai, Tiruvarur, Kanchipuram, Cuddalore, and Tanjore closed schools on December 12. By: Education Desk New Delhi | Updated: December 13, 2024 11:53 IST 2 min read The Thoothukudi district administration has issued a flood warning in the Srivaikuntam and Eral areas due to heavy inflows into the Thamirabarani river. (Image: AI generated) Schools Closed: The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted heavy rainfall in certain districts of Tamil Nadu, owing to which the district collectors of Villupuram, Tirunelveli (Nellai), Thoothukudi, and Tenkasi closed the schools today (December 13).
Following the cloudburst, districts like Chennai, Ramanathapuram, Dindigul, Pudukottai, Tiruvarur, Kanchipuram, Cuddalore, and Tanjore closed schools on December 12.
The Thoothukudi district administration has issued a flood warning in the Srivaikuntam and Eral areas due to heavy inflows into the Thamirabarani river. People in low-lying areas have been advised to move to safe places.
Advertisement In Chennai, the Public Works Department (PWD) has issued the first flood warning for the areas near the Redhills and Chembarambakkam reservoirs, the city‚Äôs chief sources of drinking water. The warning follows the dangerous increase in water levels due to incessant rain in the catchment areas.
Due to a heavy downpour upstream of Thamirabarani, a flood warning was issued to all villages and towns situated on the banks of the river, the administration said.
The revenue officials have been instructed to evacuate the people from all vulnerable places in Srivaikundam and Eral. Police and Fire and rescue services personnel have asked people to shift to safer areas.
(with inputs from PTI)
